CACHE - Cache Control
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for interfacing with the Cache Controller on Apollo5 devices. It supports instruction and data cache control, cache invalidation, power management, and prefetch configuration for optimal memory performance.

Key Features

  1. Instruction Cache: Control instruction cache enable/disable.
  2. Data Cache: Control data cache enable/disable and cleaning.
  3. Cache Invalidation: Invalidate cache ranges and regions.
  4. Power Management: Cache power control and management.
  5. Prefetch Configuration: Configure cache prefetch parameters.

Functionality

  • Enable and disable instruction and data caches
  • Invalidate cache ranges and regions
  • Clean data cache for memory consistency
  • Manage cache power states
  • Configure cache prefetch parameters

Usage

  1. Enable caches using am_hal_cachectrl_icache_enable() and am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_enable()
  2. Invalidate caches as needed with am_hal_cachectrl_icache_invalidate()
  3. Clean data cache with am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_clean()
  4. Manage cache power states
  5. Configure prefetch parameters as required

Configuration

  • Cache Enable: Configure instruction and data cache enable/disable
  • Invalidation: Set up cache invalidation ranges and parameters
  • Power States: Configure cache power management
  • Prefetch: Set up cache prefetch configuration

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_req_e

enum am_hal_cachectrl_req_e

CACHECTRL Request.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_REQ_PREFETCH_CFG 

Used to change the the CM55 pre-fetch configuration. Pass am_hal_cachectrl_prefetch_t* as pArgs

AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_REQ_MAX

Power control for caches.

Parameters

Parameters

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_clean()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_clean ( am_hal_cachectrl_range_t * pRange)

Clean the Data cache.

Parameters
pRange- pointer to an address range to clean. If NULL, then clean the entire cache.

Use this function to clean the dcache.

Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_disable ( void )

Disable the Data cache.

Use this function to disable dcache. Other configuration settings are not not required.

Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_enable ( bool bClean)

Enable the Data cache for operation.

Parameters
bClean- TRUE: Clean the dcache in addition to invalidating it. FALSE: Simply invalidate the cache.
Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_invalidate()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_dcache_invalidate ( am_hal_cachectrl_range_t * pRange,
bool bClean )

Invalidate the Data cache.

Parameters
pRange- pointer to an address range to invalidate. If NULL, then invalidate the entire cache.
bClean- TRUE: Clean the dcache in addition to invalidating it. FALSE: Simply invalidate the cache.

Use this function to invalidate the dcache.

Returns
Status.
